unnormalised: Okay, here's a Quora post on Home Loan Schemes:
normalised: Subject: Home Loan Schemes - Need some help figuring them out, friend!

unnormalised: **Subject: Home Loan Schemes - Need some help figuring them out, yaar!**

normalised: So, I'm finally thinking about buying a flat in Mumbai (dream come true!), hopefully near Powai lake. But the whole home loan thing is kind of confusing. There are so many schemes out there!

unnormalised: So, I'm finally thinking about buying a flat in Mumbai (dream come true!), hopefully near Powai lake. But the whole home loan thing is kinda confusing. There are so many schemes out there!
normalised: Can anyone shed some light on the popular home loan schemes available in India right now? I've heard H D F C and S B I have some decent options, but I'm not sure which one would be best for me. I need a loan of around rupee fifty lakhs. My salary comes on the first of every month, so repayment shouldn't be a problem.

unnormalised: Can anyone shed some light on the popular home loan schemes available in India right now? I've heard HDFC and SBI have some decent options, but I'm not sure which one would be best for me. I need a loan of around Rs. 50 Lakhs. My salary comes on the 1st of every month, so repayment shouldn't be a problem.
normalised: I’ve been researching but it's all jargon! What's the deal with the different interest rates? Fixed, floating, blended... head explodes. Also, what documents do I really need to get ready? I have my Aadhar card and P A N card, of course.

unnormalised: I’ve been researching but it's all jargon! What's the deal with the different interest rates? Fixed, floating, blended... *head explodes*. Also, what documents do I *really* need to get ready? I have my Aadhar card and PAN card, of course.
normalised: Heard from my friend Rajeev that P N B has a good scheme specifically for salaried folks. Anyone have experience with them?

normalised: Ideally, I want to finalize something before Diwali, say by twenty fifth october two thousand and twenty four. Any tips or advice would be greatly appreciated!
